column1: These victims who are often older veterans and first generation students should be able to access relief from the loans they took out to attend these fraudulent schools and move forward with their lives. #StandWithStudents https://t.co/FWWQET4b0S

Students defrauded by for-profit colleges are often left with crippling debt useless degrees and none of the opportunities they were promised. This is wrong and today the House of Representatives reversed an unnecessarily cruel rule enacted by Secretary DeVos.

My staff will be hosting. mobile office hours at the Lincoln County Veteran Service Office tomorrow from 9 am to 1 pm.  If you are having an issue with a federal agency please stop by and meet with one of my caseworkers.   1231 SE Bay Blvd Suite A Newport OR 97365
The U.S. must not become involved in another conflict in the Middle East.

I have long opposed U.S. intervention in the Middle East. I cosponsored and voted for a resolution today that would prevent the President from taking further military action in Iran without Congressional approval.

Since I came to Congress in 2009 I have adamantly opposed military intervention in the Middle East. I remain staunchly opposed to U.S. involvement in another costly conflict in the Middle East.   Read my full statement below:   https://t.co/K6bW8f564d

Nick Fish was the definition of what public service should be. He served the community of Portland honorably and put people above ideology. His loss will be felt deeply and I will miss him greatly. My thoughts are with the Fish family during this time.  https://t.co/rmkdVYpHSA
https://t.co/J6VBLcAkUU

In Oregon 306344 people are living with diabetes. HR 3 will lower the cost of the insulin NovoLOG Flexpen by 76%! Some commonly used insulins will cost as little as $400 annually under HR 3.

In OR-05 alone 130603 people are enrolled in Medicare Part D plans and 571127 people are enrolled in private health insurance. That is over 700000 people in OR-05 who will benefit from the passage of HR 3!

This week the House of Representatives will be voting on HR 3 the Lower Drug Costs Now Act. Throughout the week I will be sharing how this groundbreaking legislation will help hardworking Oregonians afford the medicine they need to lead healthy lives. #LowerDrugCosts

Nothing in our democracy is more sacred than the right to vote. Since #SCOTUS gutted the Voting Rights Act six years ago in its Shelby County v. Holder decision Selma's legacy has been unraveled by discrimination. I’m proud to have voted for #HR4 #RestoreTheVote https://t.co/948Z67cl2N

I signed on to a resolution with over 120 of my colleagues lead by @RepSchneider condemning the Trump Administration’s withdrawal from the Paris Climate Agreement. We need action and leadership on climate change now and continued global coordination in combating this crisis.

@EnergyCommerce @HouseCommerce My bill with Mr. Gianforte will provide certainty to consumers by ensuring transparency in the calculations of drug costs. This bill will reign in pricing schemes that hide the true cost of medications and prevent their costs from skyrocketing!

@EnergyCommerce @HouseCommerce PBMs are the middlemen who work with states governments and businesses to negotiate drug prices for the people on their health insurance plans. 3 organizations control 85% of the market. The lack of transparency into their practices has lead to the rising cost of prescriptions.

Today I introduced the bipartisan PBM Transparency and Prescription Drug Costs Act (HR 5304) with my colleague Greg Gianforte a fellow member of @EnergyCommerce @HouseCommerce.  https://t.co/Aa1sC3pcdL

Our tour today is over.   We are now meeting to share our initial impressions and ideas to help alleviate some of the hardships for migrants and how to empower the agencies on the ground in Texas to do a better job.  Our press conference will be streamed live on Facebook.
These images are being posted publicly and are available for media use.

This is a play pen for toddlers who came to the border unaccompanied. This is an unbelievable situation where horrific conditions are the first hope at a better life in America. https://t.co/bhjrCVFlfx

I do not always have the right thing to say. But I am a father to 8 amazing kids and I think of them. These kids here in Texas are so tough. They came to America with hope of a better life. We have to move past the partisan rhetoric and do what is right for innocent children. https://t.co/xiSLNMDmkF

This is a beautiful baby that I just met. He was brought here by a man whose DNA did not match his. This is huge problem men are kidnapping innocent children and using them to get across the border. This is bigger than political party. These are innocent kids and we have to help https://t.co/wDo2J7ukt9
Men without children are being held longer. There are no facilities to move them too. https://t.co/XNfQaXa5ei

Young men here are in bunkbeds. 4-6 to a room. I met a very kind young man from Guatemala whose parents saved up to send him to the United States. Life there is bad and there are few opportunities for young people.
Now touring HHS facilities where boys ages 13-17 stay. Average stay is 55 days. Longest stay in the facility was 600 days before reunification.
We are being told that there are two microwaves to feed all of the migrants coming through Port of Hidalgo. Some days there are as many as 2000 people seeking entry.
These images are posted publicly and available for media use.
*sound on*  We are heading across the bridge to Mexico https://t.co/bfLOEFqtAP

Having frank and at times difficult conversations with the immigration officials here. I feel like they are being honest and straightforward about the situation here at Hidalgo-I have very grateful for their time and insight. https://t.co/mCs0BF7qkL

Now at the Port of Hidalgo.   This line of cars is lined up to come in via the Port. Many people are transported here by cartels for thousands of dollars.   Folks are here for 24-48 hours and released to Catholic charities. https://t.co/ZuQuDOACMk

It is snack time for the kids here at the processing facility.   We are talking to them about what it is like here and how they are doing.   This "pod" is for women and children. https://t.co/Wov2lmjPqr
Here in McAllen Texas. Having our first meeting with Border Patrol officers. This facility processes families only for 24-48 hours. https://t.co/g2L49BDmq3
